item.title: Baked Beans
item.description: Adapted from Alton Brown’s recipe. Ingredients 1 can great northern beans 1 can black beans 1 onion, chopped 2 jalapenos, chopped 1/4 cup tomato paste 1/4 cup dark brown sugar 1/4 cup molasses 2 cups vegetable broth 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper 1 teaspoon black pepper 1 teaspoon kosher salt Directions preheat oven to 250 degrees in a cast iron Dutch oven over medium heat, sweat onion and jalapenos to soften, about 5 minutes stir in the tomato paste, dark brown sugar, and molasses add the beans and vegetable broth and bring to a boil over high heat add in cayenne, black pepper and salt; stir and cover with the lid place the Dutch oven in the oven while preparing to smoke configure grill for indirect heat around 250 degrees add smoke wood and beans; smoke for 1 hour

item.title: Gochujang Wing Sauce
item.description: Ingredients 2 tablespoons butter 2 tablespoons gochujang 1 tablespoon soy sauce 1 tablespoon minced garlic 2 teaspoons minced ginger or 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger 2 tablespoons honey 2 tablespoons rice wine or water 1 tablespoons rice vinegar or white vinegar Directions mix all ingredients in saucepan over medium heat

item.title: Habanero Hot Sauce
item.description: Notes wear gloves ventilate very well or you will pepper spray yourself store for up to 3 months in the refrigerator Ingredients 15-20 habanero peppers 1/2 cup white vinegar 4 teaspoons olive oil 4 teaspoons white sugar 2 cloves garlic 1/2 teaspoon salt Directions wash peppers thoroughly remove stems and seeds; roughly chop peppers and garlic heat oil in medium sauce pan over low heat add the peppers and cover; cook, stirring occasionally until pepper soften, about 8 minutes add the garlic; continue cooking until fragrant, about 2 minutes add vinegar, sugar, and salt bring to a simmer, cover, cook for 10 minutes on low heat remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes, covered pour mixture into a blender or food processor, blend until smooth
